question.text: The number of immigration is more than emigration and death are lower than natality. Growth curve of the population will show:

solution.text: In any population, when the sum of immigration and natality is more than the sum of emigration and death rate, then the overall population or population density is increased. Human population show a sigmoid growth curve in which mainly 4 phases are there - <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> Lag phase - growth is comparatively slow. <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> Exponential phase - Growth is very high and continuously increasing. <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> Declining phase - growth is decreased. <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> Steady phase - growth is zero or stationary.
